intro: Ononis alopecuroides subsp. alopecuroides, commonly known as lesser burnet, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its dense, tufted foliage and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically reaches a height of about 10 to 30 centimeters and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its leaves are pinnately compound, consisting of several pairs of oval-shaped leaflets. This species is well adapted to dry, sunny environments and is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive appearance and hardiness.
